author: Special Correspondent
text:
Having received an overwhelming support and response from residents in the first three weeks, the ‘Car-Free Sundays’ initiative of The Hindu Tamil, in partnership with Coimbatore Corporation and Coimbatore City Traffic Police, has arranged a new set of events for the fourth week on March 20.

A variety of events are lined up for the participants on NSR Road in Coimbatore from 6.30 a.m. to 9 a.m.

The Hindu – English is the media partner.

Events

Some of the events are as follows: a fitness session by Beethovan Fitness Centre from 6.30 a.m. to 7 a.m.; a music show by DPS Music from 7 a.m. to 7.20 a.m.; ‘Illusions’ by Tharun Iyer from 7.25 a.m. to 7.45 a.m.; Ranjith School of Dance presents a 20-minute event from 7.50 to 8.10 a.m., folk dance performances by the students of Bharathiar University from 8.15 a.m. to 8.35 a.m., and a skit by the students of AJK College 8.35 a.m. onwards.

These are just a few events to name and there are many more off-stage and on-stage events by local talents.

In addition to all this, along the entire 800 meter stretch there would be portrait sketching, tattooing, children displaying their drawing skills on the road, cycling besides a host of sports by local residents and children.

Radio City is the Radio Partner and Mark 1 Events is the event manager.
title: Car-Free Sundays: new events to enthral participants
